pullRequest.body:
Before, we had
```
[hK : NormedField K] (h : IsNonarchimedean (norm : K ‚Üí ‚Ñù))
```
Now we use `[hK : NormedField K] [IsUltrametricDist K]` to convert between ultrametrically normed fields and valued fields.
This allows the instance to be a scoped instance instead of a def, since `IsUltrametricDist` is a class on the type, as opposed to a plain prop about the norm of the type.
The instance is scoped because otherwise, one gets a TC loop.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [ea9179472b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17561/commits/ea9179472b0b2b185f63e4dc8b8082fc6e59bef9)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.Valued.NormedValued | 1444 | 1454 | +10 (+0.69%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.Valued.NormedValued`|10|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ coe_valuation_eq_rankOne_hom_comp_valuation`
`+ instance : IsUltrametricDist L`
`+ instance {K : Type*} [NontriviallyNormedField K] [IsUltrametricDist K] :`
`+ isNonarchimedean_norm`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

> That doesn't work well for defining a valuation or the data of a `Valued`.

Could you explain what you mean by this? I have been successfully using the existing version.

Consider my PR on proving that locally compact iff complete and DVR of the valuation ring and finite residue field. To talk about the valuation ring `Valued.integer`, I need a `Valued` in the TC. This is easier to provide to the TC table by a TC-implicit argument `[IsUltrametricDist X]` than an explicit `(h : IsNonarchimedean norm)`. If it is an explicit argument, then there is no way to create the scoped instance -- an explicit argument of the proof about the norm is not available to TC synthesis.

https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16733/files#diff-e2953739e89168dcbb0040fe18b7996a54734ee000cfa73813c6a324d3c2f8a9R26-R37

> If it is an explicit argument, then there is no way to create the scoped instance -- an explicit argument of the proof about the norm is not available to TC synthesis.

But you could still create a local instance where you need it, instead of a scoped one, right? That is what I did for example to get the `Valued` structure on `Q_p^alg`:
```lean
instance valuedField : Valued (QPAlg p) ‚Ñù‚â•0 :=
  NormedField.toValued (QPAlg.isNonarchimedean p)
```

In any case, I am not against these changes now that `IsUltrametricDist` is available, but I would change the PR comment - you could get the `Valued` data before; the comment should instead explain that the problem was to make it a scoped instance instead of just a def.

For a concrete field, you'd be able to make the local instance, but lemma wouldn't work for an arbitrary field because there is no` [Fact (IsNonarchimedean ...)]` in the TC context. I'll update the comment.

> For a concrete field, you'd be able to make the local instance, but lemma wouldn't work for an arbitrary field because there is no` [Fact (IsNonarchimedean ...)]` in the TC context. I'll update the comment.

In Lean 3 (where I first implemented this), it was not possible to have these two `Valued` and `NormedField` instances at the same time on a general field because of inference loops, even if one of the instances was only declared as a local instance. Can you confirm that this is not a problem in Lean 4? (I think that this is the case, but I would like to be sure).
LGTM, thanks! @loefflerd, do you have any comments?
+1 from me
maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by mariainesdff.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11452998405/job/31864755644)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11452998405/job/31864755467)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
If it does not cause problems with inference loops, could you also add the reverse `NormedField.toValued` local instance inside the `NormedField` namespace?
done in [fce8539](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17561/commits/fce8539cd02f471cd3ff85db12aff7eabad75fc0)
Should this be `scoped[Valued] attribute [instance] Valued.toNormedField`?

You had asked
> If it does not cause problems with inference loops, could you also add the reverse NormedField.toValued local instance inside the NormedField namespace?

That's what I did. Can change it to scope different. What do you prefer?

I am sorry if I did not explain myself well. This comment is related to my question [above](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17561#issuecomment-2416163020) (which you may have missed). My reason for asking was that, in Lean 3, the local instance you had in the previous commit:

```lean
local instance : NormedField L := Valued.toNormedField L Œì‚ÇÄ
```
could not be added, since that caused inference loops.
In theory, these simple loops can be handled by Lean 4, but in practice there can still be some issues (which is why I was asking whether you had run into any trouble).
From my point of view, `Valued.toNormedField` and `NormedField.toValued` are completely symmetrical, which is why I was asking you to add the second one (but I did not mean you had to modify the first). 
I am not sure whether they both need to be scoped to avoid loops or not (hence my question), but if they do, I think they should live in different scopes.

Got it! Yes, I did see the question. Unscoped, existing heartbeat tests for finding instances get worse, so even if there isn't a stuck loop, it worsens performance to make both available globally. Having them `local` or `scoped` works totally fine in Lean4.

I agree that it makes sense to have both scoped. What scope do you want for each? 
`Valued.toNormedField` in `NormedField` or in `Valued`? And of course, the other one would be the opposite.
I would put `Valued.toNormedField` in `Valued`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Topology/Algebra/Valued/NormedValued): rely on TC IsUltrametricDist instead of explicit arg
